activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan K. Steele

records.addlTxt: 11:36 AM Attorney Anne M. Katte in court for Megan K. Steele.  Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Also calling 22CF193, 22CF228 and 22CF248.    Atty Katte statement to court- spoke with defendant on Friday.  11:37 a.m.: defendant appears in court and Atty Katte asks for a brief recess.  Court takes short recess. 11:41 a.m.:   Back on record on all cases.  Court notes has been handed a waiver or preliminary hearing for 2 of 3 cases, 22CF193 and 22CF248.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Atty Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Atty Katte willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Court notes will have a preliminary hearing in Case 22CF228 and 22CF193 and 22CF248 will track.  Court will set for preliminary hearing in 22Cf228 for 11-17-2022 at 3:30 and 22CF193 and 22CF248 to track along.  Atty Sowinski statement to court regarding witness.  Atty Katte waives time limits.  Bond continued. adj.11:48 am.
Not to discuss case with T.S.

2:57 PM Defendant Megan K. Steele in court. Attorney Anne M. Katte in court for Megan K. Steele. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 22CF228 Set for an initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Schiek statement to bond. Court continues bond in 22CF193 & sets bond in 22CF228. Svehlek statement to bond conditions in 22CF193.

3:10 PM Judge Mary Burns mentoring with Judge Neal Nielsen. Defendant Megan K. Steele in court.  Attorney Michael Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant has reached out to Public Defender's office and will reach out again. Bail continued. adj. 3:14 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Megan K. Steele
Current: 6972 Orchard Lane 7B, Three Lakes, WI 54562 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 6966 Winkler Rd, Three Lakes, WI 54562
May not possess any illegal substances.  N contact with Co defendant Dakota Slack

1:50 PM Defendant Megan K. Steele appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel has been trying to call PD - gives statement. has counsel but doesn't remember her name.  Sowinski statement - that is Marathon County.  
Sowinski statement regarding bond  - has spoke with Sheriff's dept. but does not have current residence. -Court questions defendant regarding residence. - will be residing with Mother in Three Lakes, Court 
modifies to sig bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:33 PM Defendant Megan K. Steele appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on residence. Court sets bond. adj. 01:38 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
